intro: Ligularia auriculata, commonly known as the golden bell, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It features large, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive auriculate base, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a dramatic foliage plant.
